description: From Ancient Greek παρά (pará, “beside, abnormal”) + αἴσθησις (aísthēsis, “sensation”).

nouns.description: paresthesia (countable and uncountable, plural paresthesias or paresthesiae)

entries.meaning: A sensation of burning, prickling, itching, or tingling of the skin, with no obvious cause.
examples: Paresthesia occurs when a body part 'falls asleep'.
